casebody.data:
IN RE MURRIN BROTHERS 1885, LTD., ERI-BBTX, LLC, and Concho Minick, Individually and Derivatively on Behalf of Billy Bob's Texas Investments, LLC, Philip Murrin, and Cowtown Concessions, Inc., d/b/a River Ranch Stockyards, Relators NO. 02-18-00158-CV Court of Appeals of Texas, Fort Worth. DELIVERED: July 3, 2018 ATTORNEYS FOR RELATORS: AIMEE M. FURNESS, HAYNES AND BOONE, LLP, DALLAS, TEXAS, JOE D. TOLBERT, BRACKETT & ELLIS PC, FORT WORTH, TEXAS, STEPHEN M. PEZANOSKY, HAYNES AND BOONE, LLP, FORT WORTH, TEXAS, WILLIAM S. SNYDER, SAYLES WERBNER, DALLAS, TEXAS, ANDREW D. SIMS, HARRIS, FINLEY & BOGLE, P.C., FORT WORTH, TEXAS. ATTORNEYS FOR REAL PARTIES IN INTEREST: RANDY JOHNSTON, CHARLES "CHAD" BARUCH, JOHNSTON TOBEY BARUCH, P.C., DALLAS, TEXAS, MARSHALL M. SEARCY, JR., JOHN H. CAYCE, JR., KELLY HART & HALLMAN LLP, FORT WORTH, TEXAS. PANEL: GABRIEL, J.; SUDDERTH, C.J.; and MEIER, J.

MEMORANDUM OPINION 1

See Tex. R. App. P. 47.4, 52.8(d).

PER CURIAM

The court has considered relators' petition for writ of mandamus, the real parties in interest's response, and the relators' reply and is of the opinion that relief should be denied. Accordingly, relators' petition for writ of mandamus is denied.
